text: This absolutely is not a refrigerator.  At best it cools to between 50F and 55F.  A normal refrigerator stays at around 40F which is recommended by the FDA as it keeps microorganisms such as salmonella, E. coli, and listeria at bay.  The temperature this device keeps is not nearly cool enough for anything that could spoil and does not keep beverages cold but only cool.  No one should ever consider putting food or dairy or anything else that requires refrigeration in this for any length of time as they will almost certainly end up with spoiled food or drink.
title: Not cold enough to bother with

text: I love this little fridge. It takes a day or 2 to get to its coldest, but now I can put a soda in at 7:30 and it will be perfect by lunchtime! I keep it at the office (I have a black one so it blends in with my computer) and I usually use the top shelf for my lunch (no more missing lunches at work) and bottom for cans, I can also take the shelf out to put in a big gatorade. I can't imagine it being all that helpful in a vehicle due to how long it takes to get cold, but I don't think I will be using it there. Also, it doesn't make a noise, I didn't think it was working at first because I expected a noise but it's totally silent. (A word of caution: don't be rough on the handle, when I got mine all the displays had broken handles so be gentle, mine is holding up but I can see how being rough could damage it)
